question_text:
The point L(4,-4) is rotated 90° counterclockwise around the origin. What are the coordinates of the resulting point, L'?
L' = (_, _)
backend_description: The image shows a coordinate grid labeled from -6 to 6 on both axes. A blue point labeled L is located in the lower-right quadrant at (4, -4).
solution: 90° is 1/4 of a full turn. The rotation will turn the point 1/4 of a full turn in the counterclockwise direction.
Start with the point (4,-4).

Rotate the point 90° counterclockwise around the origin. The point will move from Quadrant IV to Quadrant I. To find the exact location, imagine (0,0) and L forming opposite corners of a box. Rotate the box, keeping the (0,0) corner fixed.
L' has coordinates (4,4).
solution_image_tag: The image shows a coordinate grid from -6 to 6 on both axes. A thick curved arrow in purple indicates a 90° counterclockwise rotation starting from the positive x-axis and ending on the positive y-axis. This visual represents the direction of rotation around the origin.
The image shows a coordinate grid with a blue point labeled L at the coordinates (4, -4), located in the fourth quadrant. This represents the original position of point L before the rotation.

The image shows a coordinate grid with two colored rectangles forming a square around the origin. A blue point labeled L is at (4, -4) and a green point labeled L′ is at (4, 4). A black dot marks the origin. The configuration visually shows that point L has been rotated 90°

Rotate the point 270° clockwise around the origin. The point will move from Quadrant I to Quadrant II. To find the exact location, imagine (0,0) and M forming opposite corners of a box. Rotate the box, keeping the (0,0) corner fixed.
M' has coordinates (-6,6).
solution_image_tag: The image shows a coordinate grid from -10 to 10 on both axes. A thick curved arrow in purple indicates a 270° clockwise rotation. This visual represents the direction of rotation around the origin.
The image shows a coordinate grid with a blue point labeled M at the coordinates (6, 6), located in quadrant I. This represents the original position of point M before the rotation.

The image shows a coordinate grid with two colored rectangles forming a square around the origin. A blue point labeled M is at (6, 6) and a green point labeled M′ is at (-6, 6). A black dot marks the origin. The configuration visually shows that point M has been rotated 270° clockwise.
